SEARCH
Module com.example.demo
Package com.example.demo.controller

Class Control_PauseMenu

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.controller.Control_PauseMenu
public class Control_PauseMenu extends Object
The Control_PauseMenu class handles the functionality of the pause menu in the game. It allows for showing and hiding the pause menu, as well as resuming the game.

  • Field Summary

  • Field Details

    • pauseMenuManager

      private PauseMenuManager pauseMenuManager
      Manages the functionality of the pause menu in the game. This object handles the logic for pausing, resuming, and closing the game.

    • pauseMenuPane

      private javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane pauseMenuPane
      The AnchorPane that contains the pause menu. This pane holds the UI elements for the pause menu.

    • continueButton

      private javafx.scene.control.Button continueButton
      The button that allows the player to continue the game after it has been paused. This button resumes the game and hides the pause menu.

    • mainRoot

      private javafx.scene.layout.Pane mainRoot
      The root container of the main user interface. This container holds all UI components for the main screen.

  • Constructor Details

    • Control_PauseMenu

      public Control_PauseMenu()
      No-argument constructor for Control_PauseMenu. Initializes default values for fields and ensures the pause menu is hidden initially.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(PauseMenuManager pauseMenuManager)
      Initializes the pause menu controller with the provided PauseMenuManager. It hides the pause menu and continue button by default.
      Parameters:
      pauseMenuManager - The PauseMenuManager instance used to manage the game state.

    • showPauseMenu

      public void showPauseMenu()
      Toggles the visibility of the pause menu and continue button. If the pause menu is hidden, it will be shown, and vice versa.

    • handleContinue

      private void handleContinue()
      Handles the continue button click to resume the game. Hides the pause menu and continue button, and removes the blur effect from the main interface.

    • hidePauseMenu

      public void hidePauseMenu()
      Hides the pause menu and the continue button without resuming the game.
